The most toxic part of Moringa oleifera is the bark and the root, and the safest part is the leaves; it is important to test their toxicity. In addition, sensory analysis is mandatory before developing the food matrix, because significant alterations in taste and flavour could occur if the level of Moringa oleifera is not adequate. Alterations in sensory characteristics can certainly be a barrier to food consumption.
